articles.title: Can women's cricket be a money-spinner for India?
articles.description: Indian women cricketers are hopeful that a recent decision on match fees could open more doors for them.
articles.content:
Cricket is India's most popular sport - but it still remains a male bastion in the country.
Some recent decisions by administrators could change this, though, and open up more opportunities for aspi… [+495 chars]

articles.title: World Cup 2022: How football fever is gripping cricket-crazy India
articles.description: Fans are spending a fortune to travel to Doha to watch games and putting up cut-outs of players at home.
articles.content:
This week, Hashir Ali and 11 of his friends will make a long trip - from Kozhikode city in the southern state of Kerala to Doha, the capital of Qatar. 
Mr Ali, 55, a football-crazy civil engineer, a… [+5042 chars]

articles.title: Sri Lanka hands Karunaratne suspended ban after disciplinary inquiry - Reuters
articles.description: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) on Wednesday handed bowling all-rounder Chamika Karunaratne a suspended one-year ban from all forms of cricket following a disciplinary inquiry into violations committed at the Twenty20 World Cup in Australia.
articles.content: Nov 23 (Reuters) - Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) on Wednesday handed bowling all-rounder Chamika Karunaratne a suspended one-year ban from all forms of cricket following a disciplinary inquiry into violati… [+1417 chars]

articles.title: England name Jon Lewis as women's team head coach - Reuters.com
articles.description: England named Jon Lewis as the new head coach of their women's cricket team on Friday.
articles.content:
Nov 18 (Reuters) - England named Jon Lewis as the new head coach of their women's cricket team on Friday.
The 47-year-old former England men's seamer will replace Lisa Keightley, who left the positi… [+506 chars]
